intro: Cryptolepis stefianinii, commonly known as the African snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or yellow flowers, followed by black, berry-like fruits. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and riverbanks. Cryptolepis stefianinii is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
